Yes, for example (from test code written when I was working through Java
Puzzlers[1])

package com.javapuzzlers.p01;

import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;

import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.Collection;

import org.junit.Test;
import org.junit.runners.Parameterized.Parameters;

public abstract class OddTestAbstract {

@Parameters
public static Collection data() {
return Arrays.asList(new Object[][] { { false, 0 }, { true, 1 },
{ false, 2 }, { true, -1 }, { false, -2 } });
}

protected boolean expected;

protected int value;

@Test
public void doTest() {
assertEquals("expecting " + value + " to be odd: " + expected,
expected, isOdd(value));
}

abstract boolean isOdd(int i) ;

}

With subclasses implementing different versions of the isOdd(int) operation.

Works for me in Eclipse; I haven't tried in CC, but I expect it would work
fine.

James
